title: Senior Engineer
description:
**Join Simployer as a Senior Engineer ‍** 



Simployer is transforming HR tech, and we are on the lookout for an experienced **Senior Engineer** to help us build a world-class platform. As part of the growing team, you will work with cutting-edge technologies to create innovative features that will be used by organizations across Europe. Join us in shaping the future of HR technology as we continue to revolutionize the industry with AI-powered solutions, seamless HR systems, and exceptional user experiences.


**What You Will Do:**


* Take a lead role in the development of backend-heavy features for our platform.
* Build new features from scratch, improve existing code, and ensure it remains clean, scalable, and efficient.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the product meets both business and user needs.
* Take ownership of your work and contribute autonomously while driving product development forward.
* Contribute to system architecture design, ensuring stability and scalability as the product evolves.
**Work with great people**
--------------------------


**Thomas Ellingsen**
DevOps Engineer


"I really enjoy my job because I work with a talented and supportive team. In my work I’m able to make mistakes and learn from them. This encourages me to take risks and continuously improve my skills."
**Martin Skåksrud**
Data Analyst


"I started my work in Simployer during my studies and got the opportunity to put learnings into practice. The combination of highly competent and friendly people makes Simployer a great place to be!"
**Maria Dahlqvist**
Senior Customer Consultant HCM


"In my work I help our customers to find the best way to use our products and how to simplify their processes. Sharing our experiences help us to develop ourselves, our customers and products."
**Henrik Sandström**
Tech Presale


"I have had the privilege to work for Simployer quite a few years in different roles. The company has always listened to my requests regarding competence development which has been very positive to me."
**Michał Sekuła**
Development Team Manager


"In Simployer amazing things are delivered by amazing people. With our culture where we take care of each other we are able to grow individually and as a company and go beyond any limitations."
**Ida Ljungberg**
Legal Adviser HR & Management


"Our HR Services would have been very useful for me in my previous HR jobs. So contributing to our customers within labour law, HR and payroll is one of the reasons why I really enjoy working here!"
Skills & Requirements


**What You Will Bring to the Team:**


* Strong proficiency in **Node.js**, **TypeScript**, and experience with **REST** or **GraphQL APIs**.
* Experience developing production-grade applications, with a strong understanding of **API design** (server-to-server, server-to-client).
* Expertise in **data modeling**, and working with **cloud platforms** such as **GCP**, **AWS**, or **Azure**.
* Solid experience in **Unit Testing** and working with **Kubernetes**, **Nest.js**, **Redis**, **RabbitMQ**, **Jest**, and other technologies in the stack.
* Ability to maintain high coding standards and contribute to a collaborative, agile development environment.
* Strong communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
* A passion for building innovative software and contributing to a thriving development culture.


**What We See as a Plus:**


* Experience working with AI/ML technologies in a backend context.
* Experience in the **Tech** or **SaaS** industries.
* Knowledge of **Integration Testing** and **TDD** practices.


**Our Tech Stack:**Node.js, TypeScript, MongoDB, Nest.js, GraphQL API, REST API, Redis, RabbitMQ, Jest, Kubernetes, GCP



**Message from the Hiring Manager:**



“*Hi! I'm Herman, the Engineering Manager for the HR Core team. In this role you will be working closely with myself and a team of talented, passionate individuals dedicated to delivering high-quality products for our customers.*  

*At Simployer, I was welcomed into a culture of innovation and creative freedom, a work environment that encourages our team members to question the status quo and learn from their mistakes. So now I would like to extend this forward to yourself as well.*  

*I look forward to learning more about you, and how you can contribute to our success.*"


**What We Offer:**


* A supportive and inclusive workplace where collaboration and personal growth are prioritized.
* The flexibility to work from home or in our Stockholm office, based on your preference.
* Opportunities for personal and professional development with an emphasis on work-life balance.
* A team that inspires and supports one another in achieving our goals.
* High autonomy and responsibility, with recognition for your unique contributions.


**Our Hiring Process:**



* **Introduction meeting:** A brief chat with our recruiter for us to understand your background better, and for you to learn about us and the role (approx. 30 minutes).


* **Personality & Logic Test:** A short assessment to help us understand your problem-solving abilities and cognitive strengths via Alva Labs


* **Technical Screening:** Meet with someone from your future team to assess your experience and skills, and for you to learn more about the projects we are working on (approx. 45 minutes).


* **Technical Interview:** A deeper dive into your technical expertise with our tech leaders, and for you to get a better feel for our team (approx. 60 minutes).


* **Informal HR Interview**: Before making an offer, we’ll have a final informal chat to answer any last questions and ensure everything feels right on both sides (approx. 30 minutes).



**We can’t wait to meet you!**



At Simployer, we believe in empowering our employees to achieve their best. Join us and contribute to a workplace where your skills and ideas can truly make a difference.


**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------


Hybrid and flexible work model


Modern offices


Pension and health care


Laughs, develops, and celebrates together


HR tech company


Career opportunities


Simployer is a “people first” company. We offer a unique combination of high-value and people-centric products, services and expertise. Our simplifying solutions are the preferred choice of more than 15,000 customers and 1,2 million users in Northern Europe. For almost four decades, we have helped our customers unleash the full potential in people, the core asset of any company. Managers who want to lead better – by inspiring, engaging and developing their employees – choose our solutions. We are on an exciting journey where we will continue to grow our company into new markets in Northern Europe. In Simployer we have a culture where it is possible to grow, and to have a direct impact on the business through empowerment and flat structure. You will work with colleagues who are passionate about their work and we can promise you that we have a lot of fun at work. To succeed in the market, reach our growth goals and continue to fulfil our vision, we need top talent who shares our conviction that people make businesses grow. Are you our next Simployee?  



  

**Our Values**
**Learn, Lead and Deliver**
With every new piece of information we acquire, and every new skill we develop, we become stronger, wiser, and more capable of delivering good products and meaningful experiences. We will never stop seeking knowledge, for it is the key that unlocks the door to our greatest potential.
We are open to new ideas and perspectives, eager to make the next move. We are curious about way of working and stay ahead of the curve. We lead by example and dare to fail fast. We're on a fun journey, as a team and together with our customer.
We put passion and dedication into our work, because we know that every delivery is an opportunity to make a difference. We approach each task with our hearts and a drive to exceed expectations. We don't just deliver, we do it with a passion for both our customer and Simployees.
We embrace what makes us human, take time to play and have fun together.
  
Hilda Westin | Contact Person

title: E2E Test Leader - Digital services - Husqvarna Pro Robotics
description:
Come join Pro Robotics digital service team in robotizing the professional greenspace industry!  

Husqvarna is in the forefront of robotizing the greenspace industry. Within the Pro Robotic R&D department, we are focused to deliver innovative, top end robotic products and digital services meeting the demands of the professional customers.
We are looking for you!
We are already a strong core team of around 90 people in the Pro Robotics R&D team, with around 25 of us focused on the digital services. We are now looking for a test leader with focus on end-to-end system with robotic mowers, digital services and other products.
The digital team within the Pro Robotics R&D department is responsible for DevOps of 2 digital services, Husqvarna Fleet Services and Uptime Center. Fleet is a system where professional customers can connect their Husqvarna products and keep track of them, get data for them, and specifically for Robotic Mowers, monitor and control them in real time.
In the role as E2E test leader you are responsible leading the end-to-end testing with robotic mowers, digital services and other products as well as the specific testing of the digital services within the digital team.
With our team and with Husqvarna, you have the opportunity to take further steps in your career, grow and take more responsibility in the future.
The Fleet tribe today has QA testers and Automation testers in the 2 development squads and 2 system testers. The Robotic Mower System test team has a test team leader and 6 test engineers.
About the position:  

Testing is the scope for the E2E test leader includes testing for:* End to end system of robotic mowers, digital services and other products
* New features in the digital services, and in the robotic mowers and other products requiring specific digital service support
* Regression testing of existing functionality in digital services
* Release testing for digital services
* Integration testing of digital services with new products and new SW releases for products
* Automation testing in the above and in the live environment for system monitoring

 Our test scope and complexity will grow as we are now developing BLE functionality to communicate with BLE connected Robotic Mowers, where there are many generations, platforms and models that have different capabilities and differ slightly in how they communicate over BLE. This means that there will be new functionality that in many cases needs to be verified towards a number of different robotic mower models.
The test leader will coordinate, plan and develop the entire testing in the Fleet tribe, end to end testing jointly between the digital team and the robotic mower system test team, and also participate in testing activities as part of the digital system test team.
 You will:* Develop and plan the end-to-end testing activities
* Plan the testing activities within the Fleet tribe
* Gradually improve test processes towards higher quality and efficiency
* Improve test documentation, such as test plans and test reports
* Make sure that processes are followed and there is a good collaboration with product teams for product that can be connected to Fleet

Qualifications:* Bachelor or Master of Science in Software Verification or Software Engineering
* Experience as a test leader with a team of testers
* 3 or more years of experience as a tester in digital services
* Interest in leading a test team, enabling the testers to test with high quality and efficiency
* Interest and experience in test documentation for strategy, planning and results
* Experience in test tools for digital development, such as Jira, Azure DevOps, Postman, etc
* Interest in combining the test leader role with also being a tester together with the other testers
* Experience in IOT systems, connected devices, BLE communications is a plus
* English language, spoken and written. Swedish is not mandatory but is a plus
  

As a person, you are target oriented, analytical, meticulous, communicative, enjoy understanding the customer needs and take the customer perspective in testing activities. You are open and curious and want to learn and develop in new technologies together with your colleagues. You have a good understanding of test methods and an interest in working with the test strategies, planning, test scenarios and test cases, performing tests and test reporting, etc.
The location for the position is in the Husqvarna office in Huskvarna.  

  

Application:  

Apply! We are looking forward to meeting our next member of the Pro Robotics R&D digital team!  

For more information about the positions please contact:
Hiring manager Magnus Westroth: magnus.westroth@husqvarnagroup.com – Digital DevOps. For more information about the recruitment process contact Talent Acquisition Partner Gorjana Dubovina, Gorjana.dubovina@husqvarnagroup.com
Last date to apply:
We are continuously accepting applications

title: Mjukvarutestledare
description:
*Drivs du av att se dina idéer bli verklighet? Välkommen till vår spännande och teknikintensiva värld.*


Din roll


Vi söker en passionerad mjukvarutestledare för att säkerställa kvalitén och tillförlitligheten i våra banbrytande mjukvaruprodukter, allt från taktiska träningssystem till autonoma system och IT-infrastruktur i den navala domänen.


Som mjukvarutestledare kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att säkerställa kvalitén och tillförlitligheten i våra taktiska träningssimulatorer och andra mjukvaruprodukter i den navala domänen. Du kommer att vara ansvarig för att planera, implementera och övervaka testcykeln för att säkerställa att produkterna uppfyller våra höga kvalitetskrav. Du kommer att ha ett närma samarbete med utvecklare, projektledare och andra intressenter för att leverera robusta och skalbara lösningar.


Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:

* Teststrategi & Planering: Utveckla och implementera omfattande teststrategier och planer som är i linje med projektmål och tidsplaner.
* Testdesign: Utforma, utveckla och genomför manuella och automatiserade testfall baserat på krav.
* Automatiserings: Arbeta med testautomatiserings för att öka testeffektivitet och testtäckning.
* Samarbete: Nära samarbeta med utvecklare, projektledare och andra team för att identifiera och lösa fel tidigt i utvecklingsprocessen.
* Felhantering: Spåra och hantera fel med hjälp av felspårningsverktyg, se till att de prioriteras, dokumenteras och åtgärdas.
* Rapportering & mätningar: Analysera testresultat och presentera regelbundna rapporter till intressenter om teststatus, mätningar och kvalitetsbedömningar.
* Kontinuerlig förbättring: Jobba för bästa praxis inom kvalitet, identifiera möjligheter att förbättra processer, verktyg och teamets färdigheter.
* Kravvalidering & kundgodkännande: Driva acceptanstester med kund för att validera produktkrav och erhålla formellt godkännande av produkten inför för lansering.


Din profil


Krav

* Omfattande erfarenhet av mjukvarutestmetodik (Agile, Scrum, Waterfall, etc.).
* Bekantskap med versionshanteringssystem (t.ex. Git) och CI/CD-pipelines.
* Erfarenhet av manuell och automatiserad mjukvarutestning.
* Van att arbeta med felspårningsverktyg (t.ex. Azure DevOps eller Jira).
* Förståelse för mjukvaruutvecklingsprocesser och Agil metodik.
* Stark analytisk förmåga och uppmärksamhet på detaljer.
* Utmärkta skriftliga och muntliga kommunikationsfärdigheter (svenska och engelska).


Önskvärd kompetens

* Praktisk erfarenhet av automatiseringsverktyg (t.ex. Selenium, MsTest, Coded UI test, etc.).
* Erfarenhet med prestandatestverktyg (t.ex. LoadRunner, JMeter).
* Kunskap om skript- och programmeringsspråk (t.ex. JavaScript, PowerShell-skriptning eller C#).


Vad du blir en del av


Ett team av erfarna mjukvaruingenjörer som huvudsakligen arbetar med utvecklingen av avancerade taktiska träningssimulatorer inom den navala domänen. Vi har en bred teknisk kompetens, älskar att utforska nya teknologier och strävar efter att vara bäst på det vi gör.


Bakom våra innovationer står de människor som gör dem möjliga. Modfällda pionjärer och nyfikna sinnen. Dagliga hjältar och uppfinningsrika problemlösare. De som delar djupgående kunskap och de som utforskar högt. Och alla däremellan.


Att gå med oss innebär att göra en inverkan tillsammans, bidra på vårt eget unika sätt. Från att skapa komplex kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att bara dela en kopp kaffe med en kollega, varje handling räknas. Vi uppmuntrar dig att ta på dig utmaningar, skapa smarta uppfinningar och växa i vår vänliga och tekniskt kunniga arbetsmiljö. Vi har ett fast mål att hålla människor och samhället säkert.


Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med en beständig mission att hjälpa nationer att hålla sina medborgare och samhället säkra. Med hjälp av sina 23 000 talangfulla medarbetare driver Saab ständigt gränserna för tekniken för att skapa en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.


Saab designar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flyg, vapen, kommando och kontroll, sensorer och undervattensystem. Saab har huvudkontor i Sverige. Företaget har stora verksamhet över hela världen och är en del av den inhemska försvarskapaciteten i flera nationer. Läs mer om oss här


Om du är intresserad av vilka förmåner du kan ta del av som anställd på Saab i Sverige, kan du läsa mer om dem här


Vi utvärderar kandidater kontinuerligt, vilket innebär att tjänsten kan tillsättas innan annonseringen löper ut.


Om du är en person som drivs av utmaningar och vill vara en del av ett innovativt och framåtblickande företag, ser vi fram emot din ansökan.


Frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta Andreas Carlsson, Head of Training & Simulation Saab Kockums, andreas.carlsson4@saabgroup.com


Frågor om rekryteringsprocessen? Kontakta Sofie Nilsson, Rekryterare, sofie.nilsson1@saabgroup.com


Vänligen observera att kommande ledighet kan påverka svarstid.


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: Software Systems Engineer
description:
*Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Här bidrar du till att skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll.*


Din roll


Vi på Saab utvecklar några av världens mest tekniskt avancerade produkter. I en föränderlig värld tar vi fram komplexa system och framställa framtidens mjukvara för ubåtar och ytfartyg som bidrar till att upprätthålla Sveriges gränser. Vi bidrar därmed att skapa trygghet för att skydda människor och vårat samhälle!


Som mjukvaruutvecklare blir du en del i ett team, som arbetar med en blandning av beprövade och moderna verktyg som t.ex. Azure DevOps, Git och Visual Studio. Mjukvaruutvecklingen sker främst i C#.


Teamet arbetar enligt agil utvecklingsmetodik, och planerar arbetet i tidsavgränsade intervall, så kallade sprintar.


Som utvecklare hos oss kommer du att jobba med flera olika delar i utvecklingskedjan. Analysera och bryta ner kundkrav, arbeta med systemering, design, implementation, verifiering till driftsättning ute hos kund. Vi utvecklar både system som är landbaserade och som ska finnas ombord på våra ytstridsfartyg och ubåtar.


Din profil


För att trivas och utvecklas i rollen söker vi dig som motiveras av att lösa problem tillsammans med andra. Du ser värdet i att dela med dig av din kunskap och erfarenhet och uppskattar möjligheten att lära ut och stötta dina kollegor.


Krav:


Du har erfarenhet av .NET och C#, Git, Cloud-baserad arkitektur och design, Linux, Container-baserade applikationer.

* Högskole- eller civilingenjörsexamen (B.Sc. eller M.Sc.) inom Computer Engineering, Computer Science eller motsvarande.
* Erfarenhet av att bygga komplexa lösningar i C# .NET
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i team med agil utvecklingsmetodik.


Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.


Vad du blir en del av


Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.


Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.


Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 22 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.


Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här


Frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta Andreas Carlsson, Head of Training & Simulation Saab Kockums, andreas.carlsson4@saabgroup.com


Frågor om rekryteringsprocessen? Kontakta Sofie Nilsson, Rekryterare, sofie.nilsson1@saabgroup.com


Vänligen observera att kommande ledighet kan påverka svarstid.


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Team Lead Development
description:
**About the Role:**  

**The Role:** Team Lead Development
  
  

**The Team:** A focused team of highly talented technologists, based in Stockholm, with strong skills across technology; development, UI, devops, testing, automation. The team is empowered and expected to make the technical decisions needed to deliver robust, great-looking products that meet customer needs, and they work closely with other parts of the organisation to achieve this. Everyone on the team is responsible for all parts of the system being built, run, and supported, making it an ideal place for a leader who wants to expand their own technical skillset as well as grow as a leader by coaching team members. The team values learning from and supporting each other in order to benefit from our different strengths and experiences. We are strong believers that collaboration is key to innovation and to produce a user experience and a technical solution that we can be proud of.
  
  

The team is responsible for designing, building, running and supporting several products within the Trade Lifecycle division.
  
  

**The Impact:** The team lead plays an important role in the success of the company, both directly through the achievements, learning and improvements of their own team, but also by driving change in tools and processes used in other parts of the technology organisation as well as by creating and facilitating cross-team collaborations.
  
  

**What’s In It For You:**  

Be part of an empowered, self-organising engineering team with people who will help you grow
  
  

Be part of an innovative and inclusive company culture
  
  

Impact the team’s strategy for architectural styles, ways of working, deployment pipelines, data locality strategies, observability metrics, frontend frameworks, and much, much more
  
  

Expand your technical skill set by working in a modern tech stack (including but not limited to Kubernetes, relational and NoSQL databases, Golang, and Python)
  
  

Help improve the environment and our society by contributing to our many social initiatives (optional)
  
  

Grow as a leader through collaborations with other leaders
  
  

Work on market-leading solutions with people across the globe
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

Foster a positive and collaborative team environment which embodies the company culture
  
  

Take technical ownership of the products built, run, and supported by the team
  
  

Provide guidance and mentorship to individuals and team to achieve their goals
  
  

Create and ensure adherence to coding standards, guidelines, and best practices
  
  

Manage tech partnerships with internal & external vendors
  
  

Schedule and participate in the on call support
  
  

**What We’re Looking For:**  

Strong ownership and responsibility traits
  
  

Wide experience from working in software development teams
  
  

Excellent communication skills
  
  

Business mindedness and a solution-oriented mindset
  
  

An aptitude and willingness to improve yourself and others
  
  

Someone who will work from the office at least 3 days per week
  
  

7+ years of software development experience
  
  

**We’d Also Prefer It if You Have:**  

A proven track record of managing people
  
  

Experience in leading at least one technical project
  
  

An interest in financial markets
  
  

About OSTTRA
  
  

Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.
  
  

OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
  
With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
  
Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
  
  

Learn more at www.osttra.com .
  
  

What’s In It For You?
  
  

**Benefits:**  

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
  
  

**Our benefits include:**  

**Health & Wellness:** Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
  
  

**Flexible Downtime:** Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
  
  

**Continuous Learning:** Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
  
  

**Invest in Your Future:** Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
  
  

**Family Friendly Perks:** It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
  
  

**Beyond the Basics:** From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.
  
**For more information on benefits by country visit:** https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
  
  

-----------------------------------------------------------
  
  

Equal Opportunity Employer
  
S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
  
  

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
  
  

**US Candidates Only:** The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision - https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp\_%20English\_formattedESQA508c.pdf

title: Data & AI Architect
description:
Come join us
  
In this role, you will combine technical depth, consulting acumen, and exceptional communication skills. You’ll engage with client C-suites as a trusted advisor while also guiding and sparring with developer teams. Your contributions will shape the future of Data & AI in Sweden while delivering measurable business value to clients.
  
Skills and experiences
  
**Skills and Experiences**  

* Deep Technical Expertise: Proven delivery experience in at least two of the following: Reporting solutions on Azure (e.g., Databricks, Microsoft Fabric, Power BI) with modern architecture patterns. Data & AI operational strategy and business alignment. Generative AI use cases using Databricks Mosaic AI and Microsoft AI Services.
* Strategic Communication: Confidence in engaging with executives and presenting complex solutions in clear business terms.
* Developer Engagement: Ability to collaborate with and mentor developer teams to ensure alignment and quality in delivery.
* Technical Leadership: Experience leading teams in delivering impactful Data & AI projects.
Languages: Fluency in Swedish (spoken and written) is strongly preferred. English fluency is required.  
* 

  

In addition, these will help you stand out:  

  

* Azure certifications such as Solutions Architect Expert or Data Engineer Associate.
* Experience with CI/CD and DevOps in Data & AI projects.
* Familiarity with modern data architectures such as Lakehouse or Data Vault.
* Cross-functional leadership experience in global or regional teams.

  
About you
  
**Characteristics that can spell success for this role:**  

* Consultative, collaborative, analytical
* Resilient, adaptable, flexible
* Humble leader, strong negotiator, relationship builder
* Passionate about tech and engaging with and advising clients

  
What you'll do
  
**Solution Delivery**  

* Design and deliver large-scale Data & AI solutions that align with client goals and modern best practices.
Provide technical leadership in at least two of the following areas: Reporting Solutions: Azure Databricks, Microsoft Fabric, Power BI, using modern architectural patterns (e.g., Delta, Lambda, Kappa). Data & AI Strategy: Creating operational models and aligning AI initiatives with business goals. Generative AI: Leveraging Databricks Mosaic AI and Microsoft AI Services.  
* 
  

**Client Engagement**  

* Act as a thought leader and trusted advisor to C-suite executives, translating technical concepts into actionable business strategies.
* Focus on the Swedish market, building strong relationships with local clients and stakeholders.
Support pre-sales activities and proactively originate opportunities by identifying client challenges and aligning them with Avanade’s capabilities.  
* 
  

**Team Collaboration**  

* Mentor junior team members and ensure delivery quality across projects.
Collaborate across teams to maintain excellence in delivery and align solutions with business growth objectives.  
* 
  

**Thought Leadership**  

* Contribute to Avanade’s thought leadership initiatives, such as speaking engagements and content creation, to showcase our Data & AI expertise in the Nordics.
* Advocate for modern Data & AI technologies and methodologies both internally and externally.

  
Enjoy your career
  
**Some of the best things about working at Avanade**  

* Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 years in a row), with exceptional development and training (minimum 80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally
* Dedicated career advisor to encourage your growth
Engaged and helpful coworkers genuinely interested in you  
* 

  

Find out more about some of our benefits: https://www.avanade.com/en/career/benefits
  
A great place to work
  
As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you will get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look!  

  

We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. Visit our Inclusion & Diversity page  

  

Create a future for our people that focuses on
• Expanding your thinking • Experimenting courageously • Learning and pivoting  

  

Inspire greatness in our people by
• Empowering every voice • Encouraging boldness • Celebrating progress  

  

Accelerate the impact of our people by
• Amazing the client • Prioritizing what matters • Acting as one  

  

We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. Avanade believes that all persons are entitled to equal employment opportunities, and we do not discriminate against our employees, applicants, or job seekers because of their race, colour, gender, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity, or any other protect group status as defined by law.
company_description: Avanade is the world’s leading expert on Microsoft. Trusted by over 5,000 clients worldwide, we solutions that unlock the full potential of people and technology.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
At Sandvik Rock Processing Solutions, we’re seeking a skilled and motivated DevOps Engineer to join our team and drive the efficiency, reliability, and scalability of our development and deployment processes. A great opportunity to work closely with development, operations, and engineering teams to build and optimize our cloud infrastructure, leveraging the latest technologies and best practices in DevOps.
Shortly about us
Our team consists of 15-20 developers divided into cross-functional sub-teams. We own and develop the end-to-end solution from software on the customers equipment, through the cloud solution and out to the mobile and web application in the hand of the user. We have high autonomy and can avoid a lot of the slower aspects of larger companies, while benefiting from the financial stability of a large profitable business.
About your job  

In this position, you design, deploy and maintain our cloud infrastructure on Azure, ensuring security, scalability and high availability. You manage containerized applications using Kubernetes, overseeing deployment, scaling and monitoring of microservices. By using Terraform to ensure consistent deployments, you implement and maintain Infrastructure as Code (IaC) solutions. You develop and manage release pipelines, supporting CI/CD best practices to improve deployment frequency, reduce lead time, and optimize recovery from incidents.
Your responsibilities include:* Application management on IoT devices for smooth integration and deployment of software to embedded devices.
* Collaborate with development teams to automate, monitor, and improve deployment workflows.
* Set up and monitor alerts, health checks, and dashboards for system and application performance.
* Troubleshoot and resolve infrastructure issues, performing root cause analysis and implementing corrective actions.
* Document processes, standards, and best practices to support knowledge sharing and team efficiency.


The location for this position is Malmö, Sweden and we offer a hybrid work solution.
Your profile  

We’re looking for skilled engineer with a bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field, or equivalent work experience. You have experience with at least one of the big cloud providers (Azure, GCP or AWS), including management of infrastructure and applications. Hands-on experience with Kubernetes is essential, along with proficiency in Terraform or other similar tools for Infrastructure such as Code (IaC). Experience in edge/IoT application deployment and maintenance is a plus, as well as familiarity with CI/CD tools and processes, such as Azure DevOps or similar. Previous experience in an agile environment, working closely with cross-functional teams, is valuable, along with a development background using Java, Typescript, C++, Kotlin or Swift.
We place great value on your personal qualities! You have strong problem-solving skills, with a proven track record of troubleshooting complex system issues in production environments. Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset enable you to build and maintain relationships. With a team-oriented approach, you foster a positive work environment and achieve collective goals.
Our culture
At Sandvik, we’re tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.
Contact information
For further information about this position, please contact Anders Hovén, recruiting manager, anders.hoven@sandvik.com
We have already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use, and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
Union contacts – Sweden* Mårten Lindberg, Unionen, +46 (0)76 111 03 36
* Riccardo Repetto, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)40 409 394
* Michael Wicktor-Ohlsson, Ledarna, +46 (0)70 251 44 57


Recruitment Specialist: Ulrika Gruffman
At Sandvik, we value work-life balance and due to the holidays, it may take a little bit longer until we reply in this process.
How to apply
Send your application no later than January 16, 2025. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0074175.
As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.
To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.*Sandvik Rock Processing Solutions is a business area within the Sandvik Group and a leading supplier of equipment, tools, parts, service and solutions for processing rock and minerals in the mining and infrastructure industries. Application areas include crushing and screening, breaking and demolition. In 2023* *, sales were approximately 11.5 billion SEK with about 2,900 employees.*

Box 510, SE-101 30 Stockholm, Sweden

description:
Stockholm
Sweden
**Job Family**


Development

1
**Job Description (Posting).**

**About HCLTech**  

HCLTech is a global technology company, spread across 60 countries, delivering industry-leading capabilities centered around digital, engineering, cloud and AI, powered by a broad portfolio of technology services and products. We work with clients across all major verticals, providing industry solutions for Financial Services, Manufacturing, Life Sciences and Healthcare, Technology and Services, Telecom and Media, Retail and CPG, and Public Services. We re powered by our people a global, diverse, multi-generational talent - representing 161 nationalities whose unique spark, perspective and boundless passion drive our culture of proactive value creation and problem-solving.  

Our purpose is to bring together the best of technology and our people to supercharge progress for everyone, everywhere our clients, partners, their stakeholders, communities, and the planet. As a company, we are deeply focused on accelerating our ESG agenda. We are also creating technology-enabled sustainable solutions with and for our clients and partners. We embed ESG imperatives into every aspect of our business and ensure that the progress we supercharge is responsible, inclusive and beneficial to all our stakeholders in the long term. We have committed to achieving net zero by 2040.  

  

To learn more about how we can supercharge progress for you, visit www.hcltech.com  

  

**Azure DevOps Lead Technical Consultant**  

  

**Job Summary**  

The Lead Consultant for DevOps Solutions in Azure is responsible for managing and implementing DevOps practices using Azure DevOps. The primary goal is to optimize the software development lifecycle by enhancing collaboration, automation, and integration between development and operations teams. (1.) **Key Responsibilities**  

1. Designing, developing, and implementing devops pipelines and workflows in azure devops.  

2. Collaborating with development and operations teams to facilitate continuous integration and continuous deployment (ci/cd).  

3. Monitoring and optimizing the performance of azure devops tools and processes.  

4. Troubleshooting and resolving issues related to devops practices in azure.  

5. Providing technical guidance and support to team members on azure devops best practices.  

6. Implementing security measures within the devops process to ensure data protection and compliance.  

7. Conducting regular assessments and evaluations to improve the efficiency of devops solutions in azure.  

  

**Skill Requirements**  

1. Proficiency in azure devops services and tools.  

2. Strong understanding of devops principles and practices.  

3. Experience with ci/cd pipelines and automation using azure devops.  

4. Knowledge of containerization technologies such as docker and kubernetes.  

5. Familiarity with scripting languages like powershell, bash, or python.  

6. Ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues in devops workflows.  

7. Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross functional teams.  

8. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail in implementing devops solutions in azure.  

  

Certifications: Azure DevOps Engineer Expert certification is preferred but not mandatory required.

title: System engineer
description:
Som systemingenjör i kundens SWEXIA-team tar du en central roll i att säkerställa drift, underhåll och vidareutveckling av en avancerad mjukvaruproduktionsmiljö. Arbetsområdet sträcker sig över allt från lagring och nätverk till specialanpassade klienter för mjukvaruutveckling, säkerhetsövervakning och systembevakning i en högst komplex infrastruktur.
  
  

**Arbetsuppgifter:**  

**– Utveckla och underhålla SWEXIA:** s mjukvarufabrik, inkluderande lagringslösningar, nätverksmiljöer, switchar, klienter och tillhörande applikationer.
  
– Säkerställa hög tillgänglighet och god prestanda för både utvecklingsteam och säkerhets-/övervakningsfunktioner.
  
– Samarbeta med utvecklingsteam för att förstå deras behov och leverera lösningar som stöder deras arbetsflöden.
  
– Bidra till framtagning och genomförande av en teknisk roadmap för SWEXIA-miljön, inklusive val och implementering av ny teknologi.
  
– Arbeta nära produktutvecklare för att förstå kommersiella projektkrav och säkerställa att mjukvarufabriken möter dessa behov.
  
– Hantera produktdata, information och dokumentation i enlighet med gällande regler för försvarssekretess.
  
  

**Din profil:**  

– Gedigen kunskap om datahallsmiljöer och DevOps-principer.
  
– Erfarenhet av att arbeta i både Linux- och Windowsmiljöer.
  
– Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att hantera och underhålla komplexa IT-system.
  
– Förmåga att arbeta såväl självständigt som i team.
  
– Mycket goda samarbets- och kommunikationsförmågor.
  
– Säkerhetsprövning kan komma att krävas.
  
  

**Vi erbjuder:**  

– En utmanande och stimulerande roll i en tekniskt avancerad miljö.
  
– Möjlighet att arbeta med ett kompetent och engagerat team.
  
– En stödjande och samarbetsinriktad arbetsplats som värdesätter laganda.
  
Denna tjänst kräver godkänd säkerhetsprövning enligt gällande regelverk. Ytterligare krav på medborgarskap kan förekomma för tjänster som kräver säkerhetsklassning.
  
Tjänsten utförs till 100% på plats hos kunden och urval sker löpande. För rätt kandidat finns goda möjligheter till förlängning av uppdraget.
  
  

Om Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Platform Success Engineer – OpenShift
description:
**Platform Success Engineer – OpenShift**
=========================================


Sista ansökningsdatum: 20 januari 2025

**Vill du vara med och driva Sveriges energiomställning som Platform Success Engineer – OpenShift**



Svenska kraftnät spelar en avgörande roll i att elektrifiera Sverige och möta klimatmålen genom att fördubbla elproduktionen. För att möta framtidens utmaningar bygger vi en robust och innovativ infrastruktur där vår OpenShift-plattform spelar en central roll.



Vi är idag cirka 500 personer på IT och kommer att växa ytterligare de kommande åren för att stödja Sveriges övergång till en fossilfri energiförsörjning. För att lyckas kommer vi att använda den senaste tekniken för att öka kapaciteten i vår infrastruktur och samtidigt accelerera utvecklingen av system och processer. Vi söker nu en **Platform Success Engineer – OpenShift** till vår enhet ”containerteknik och drift”, för att stötta våra interna utvecklingsteam och hjälpa dem att utnyttja plattformens fulla potential.


**Om tjänsten**
---------------



I denna roll blir du en nyckelperson i att stödja våra interna utvecklingsteam och intressenter i deras resa att implementera och optimera sina lösningar på OpenShift-plattformen. Du fungerar som en brygga mellan plattformen och teamen, och hjälper dem att utnyttja dess fulla potential genom att kombinera teknisk expertis med en pedagogisk och kundorienterad approach.



Du arbetar nära teamen för att sätta upp och optimera deployment-processer, automatisera arbetsflöden och stötta utvecklare med containerisering och applikationsoptimering. Genom att bygga relationer och skapa långsiktigt värde stärker du teamens förmåga att arbeta självständigt och skapar en utvecklingsmiljö som främjar effektivitet och kvalitet.


**Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:**


* Stötta utvecklingsteamen i att integrera sina applikationer och arbetsflöden på OpenShift-plattformen.
* Hjälpa till med att sätta upp och optimera deployment av applikationer och CI/CD-pipelines för plattformen.
* Automatisera installation, deployment och livscykelhantering för applikationer och plattformen.
* Agera teknisk rådgivare och bygga relationer med intressenter inom Kubernetes och omkringliggande teknologier.
* Fokusera på kunskapsöverföring och utbildning för att utvecklingsteamen ska bli självgående.


**Din bakgrund och erfarenhet**



Vi söker dig med teknisk erfarenhet och kompetens, ihop med en stark kommunikativ förmåga. Du är lösningsorienterad, arbetar strukturerat och hjälper utvecklingsteamen att bli självständiga. Din nyfikenhet och vetgirighet gör att du håller dig uppdaterad och kan vägleda teamen att utnyttja plattformens fulla potential. Dessa egenskaper lägger grunden för det goda samarbetet som är centralt för vår teamdynamik. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.



Vidare ser vi att du har en utbildning inom datasystemvetenskap, systemutveckling eller motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt. Utöver det har du:


* Minst 4 års erfarenhet av tekniskt arbete med enterprise Kubernetes-lösningar, OpenShift, inklusive installation, konfiguration och drift av OpenShift-kluster.
* Flerårig praktisk erfarenhet av DevOps-metodik, inklusive CI/CD-pipelines och automation av driftprocesser.
* Djup förståelse för infrastruktur, nätverk och lagringsbehov i medelstora till stora on-premise-miljöer.
* Erfarenhet av tekniskt ledarskap och förmåga att förklara både tekniska och icke-tekniska komplexa koncept för olika målgrupper vid införandet av containerplattformar
* Förmåga att skapa långsiktiga relationer med användare genom utbildning, teknisk support, felsökning och uppföljning.


Du behärskar även svenska och engelska flytande, både i tal och skrift.



Vi ser det som meriterande om du har:


* Certifieringar som CKA (Certified Kubernetes Administrator) eller Red Hat OpenShift Administrator/Developer.
* Erfarenhet av verktyg inom OpenShift-ekosystemet, som exempelvis Helm, Operators, Prometheus eller Grafana.
* Kunskap om loggning och övervakning samt erfarenhet av datalager som PostgreSQL och Kafka.

**Bra att veta**
----------------


* Tjänsten är placerad i Sundbyberg, Stockholm.
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 % #LI-hybrid
* Sista ansökningsdag 2025-01-20, vi tar inte emot personligt brev i samband med din ansökan.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning, beredskap kan komma att ingå.


I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Boxhill. Vid frågor kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Petra Törnblom, petra.tornblom@bhill.se eller Maria Sahlén rekryterare hos Svenska kraftnät, maria.sahlen2@svk.se. Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72 och Mikael Hedenheim, ST, tel. 010-475 84 68. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se


**Övrig information**
---------------------


Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
För mer information om säkerhetsprövning Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar. Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss: Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: Technical Lead
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**

  

* Design, develop, and implement robust integration solutions using APIs, middleware, and other technologies.
* Ensure seamless data flow between systems by building and maintaining efficient and scalable integrations.
* Troubleshoot and resolve integration issues, working closely with internal teams and external partners.
* Develop and maintain documentation for integration processes, protocols, and system configurations.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managemt, software development, and operations, to define integration requirements and deliver high-quality solutions.

title: DevOps Engineer - (Zuul)
description:
**Techster Solutions** befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst **3+** års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

  

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

  

**Description**:
  

  

You will be part of a team that develops and maintains a scalable CI system built to give development teams and suppliers the ability to rapidly develop software while keeping high-quality standards through automated testing. Our CI system is based on Zuul (an open-source CI tool) that we host in AWS and use to provide standard jobs written with Python and Ansible that developers can run to analyze, test, and build their code. The team is a key player in the software development ecosystem at Volvo Cars and our systems are used by over 1000 developers.  

  

Typical tasks in the team include monitoring and analyzing system performance metrics, troubleshooting issues at every level, from cloud infrastructure to compilation errors, and implementing solutions to integrate new platforms and tools into the CI chain.  

For this assignment we are looking for someone with experience in designing, deploying, and maintaining cloud infrastructure and with expertise in development security practices.  

  

What you’ll bring  

**Required qualifications:**  

* Master of Science in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent
* Experience working with secure deployments
* Experience of development of Zuul base jobs
* Experience working with Cloud infrastructure
* Expertise working with C/C++ and Python
* Experience working with continuous integration tools
* Understanding of software development workflow and processes


  

**Meritorious:**  

* DevOps
* Experience in software development for embedded systems
* Git/Gerrit
* Ansible
* Docker
* Linux
* Matlab
* Experience with issue tracking tools and an Agile way of working


Personal qualities:- A good ability of communication and team work is essential  

* Structured, with good analytical and problem-solving skills
* Capable of focusing on both daily issues and long term visions
* Interested in new tools and technologies
**Ansökan**  

Tror du att du är **Techster Solutions** nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.


Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: .Net Development Lead
description:
Revvity is now looking for an

**.Net** **Development****Lead**


(Permanent position)

  

Turku, Finland / Sollentuna, Sweden

**Revvity's** **Turku site has over 500 employees and is a key location for manufacturing and product development in newborn, maternal-fetal health, and prenatal screening. As a global leader in newborn screening, our solutions have tested over 700 million babies worldwide for life-threatening diseases.**


Join an experienced team dedicated to developing SaaS solutions that support newborn screening across a broad spectrum of tests. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in designing and building software that underpins the product solutions we offer.

**Key** **Responsibilities**:

* Lead and mentor the development team, fostering a collaborative and innovative environment.
* Design, develop, and maintain enterprise-level SaaS solutions using modern .Net technologies.
* Ensure the delivery of secure, reliable, and scalable code across multiple product offerings.
* Collaborate with business users to define and refine requirements.
* Conduct code reviews to maintain high standards of quality and performance.
* Oversee team workflows and prioritize tasks in an Agile environment using Jira.
* Ensure compliance with secure coding principles and industry standards.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including DevOps, QA, and product Management.
 **Essential****Skills** **and** **Experience**:

* 10+ years of experience in a commercial software development environment with proven leadership capabilities.
* Strong expertise in enterprise web application development.
* Advanced proficiency in **C# .Net** **Core** **6+**, **PostgreSQL (****or****equivalent****)**, and **API** **development**.
* Frontend development experience using **HTML5, JavaScript,** **React** **(****or****equivalent****)**, and **DevExpress** **(****or****equivalent****)**.
* Deep understanding of version control systems (**Git****/GitHub**) and Agile methodologies.
* Advanced debugging and analytical problem-solving skills.
* Familiarity with secure coding practices and standards.
* Strong communication skills with the ability to engage with stakeholders at all levels.
* Self-driven, proactive, and capable of working independently with minimal supervision.
 **Desirable****Skills** **and** **Experience**:

* Experience with **HL7** **messaging****protocols** (e.g., ADT, ORM).
* Strong database design and optimization skills.
* Familiarity with laboratory system integration (workstations, LIMS, or related systems).
* Experience with **AWS** cloud services and containerization technologies such as **Docker** and microservices architecture.
* Knowledge of regulated software development standards (e.g., **ISO 13485, IVD, FDA**).
 **What****We****Offer**:

* An opportunity to join a dynamic development team with a robust and exciting product roadmap.
* Exposure to cutting-edge technologies, including AWS and microservices.
* Collaborative work with global teams on impactful projects.
* A supportive and innovative environment that encourages personal and professional growth.
  

This role is ideal for a seasoned development leader with a passion for creating high-impact software in a dynamic and supportive team. If you’re ready to lead and innovate, we’d love to hear from you.


Revvity's Turku site is a substance-free workplace, and new employees undergo a drug test as part of the pre-employment health check.

  

If you are interested and feel you are suitable for the position, please send your CV and application by January 12th 2024 at the latest.

 **#LI-EMEA**
