title: Design and Enterprise Architect
description:
**G+D makes the lives of billions of people around the world more secure. We shape trust in the digital age with built-in security tech in three segments: Digital Security, Financial Platforms and Currency Technology. We have been a reliable partner for our customers for over 170 years with our innovative solutions for SecurityTech! We are an international technology group and traditional family business with over 14,000 employees in 40 countries. Creating Confidence is our path to success. Trust is the basis of our collaboration within G+D.**

**We are the reliable partner for all challenges resulting from the Internet of Things. We offer a complete connectivity portfolio for mobile network operators, automotive manufacturers, technology companies such as chip and module manufacturers as well as transport and logistics providers. Our portfolio includes highly secure solutions in the area of connectivity & IoT, from classic SIM, eSIM and iSIM, to the associated embedded operating systems and life cycle management, through to services for global connectivity and IoT solutions. Do you want to actively shape the digital transformation with us?**

**Give yourself an outstanding opportunity to develop and form career in a dynamic and international environment. We are now looking for an Design Architect to join us at G+D Mobile Security for a permanent position based in Stockholm.** Join our team as a Design Architect, playing a key role in shaping the service design within Professional Services. Your primary focus will be to streamline processes, reduce time to market, lower development and operations costs, and maximize automation for efficient customer delivery. As a Design Architect, you'll handle deploying services and managing processes, working closely with Service Owners and Design Specialists, as well as leading other architects in enterprise design endeavors.The abilities of the Design Architect includes advanced technical skills in the service design and architecture areas, service knowledge, IT and solution architecture, as well as a good understanding of the ITIL and overall development processes. We're in the lookout for someone with advanced technical skills in service design and architecture, IT and solution architecture, and an understanding of ITIL how things develop in our processes.


**Responsibilities:**
---------------------

* Develop global end-to-end architecture, components, and common services.
* Create blueprints for efficient G+D solution and service roll-out.
* Collaborate with R&D and Design N’ Architecture team on solution architecture and shared services.
* Evaluate and introduce new technologies for Professional Services.
* Define and document system architecture, including disaster recovery, deployment models, and non-functional requirements.
* Manage blueprint architectures and break down roadmaps into reusable components.
* Collaborate with various teams, including Product Management, Project Management, R&D, and more.
* When needed being accountable for the group of architects


**Qualifications:**
--------------------

* University degree in engineering or related technical field.
* Minimum 3 years of service design and or architecture experience in the B2B segment.
* Experience in R&D and IT, preferably in the telecommunications or payment industry.
* Advanced technical skills in Service Design and Architecture.
* Deep understanding of complex software and Enterprise solutions, IT, Cloud technologies, and Security Information systems and preferably within telecom.
* Familiarity with ITIL processes and the entire development process.

**What can we offer you?**
--------------------------


In this role you will have the opportunity to work with talented people in an international and innovative environment. G+D is a well-established family-owned company at the forefront of the market. Besides a dynamic and evolving industry, we offer you:
  

* 4500 SEK wellness allowance/year
* 3 additional days off/year
* 1 sport activity hour/week
* Collective Agreement – IT & Telekomföretagen within Almega
* Benify Portal – Health activities and discounts
* Skandia Health Insurance
* Vacation exchange
* Hybrid office 50% from home (if you want to)

Breakfast at the office every Wednesday  
* 

Get to know us and our people a little better at G+D Sweden by listening to our Jobcast below:**Shaping the next chapter of the digital age****Spotify:** https://open.spotify.com/episode/71GyhbDv090LgVyukyLf7v?si=f399b1f0d93e47e3**Acast:** **https://shows.acast.com/5cdc00c69e126b7939fb506b/646e072f95211700118d82a4** **Our DNA is in our people****Spotify:** https://open.spotify.com/episode/6BpWiUCMXr3q68dSGEr2w7?si=e4328a3c8db34b8d**Acast:** **https://shows.acast.com/5cdc00c69e126b7939fb506b/646e070580b8d100110f0e95**

title: Inside Account Executive Senior - Remote
description:
**Would you relish the opportunity to sell world-class technical solutions?**


**Are you passionate about cutting-edge technology and driving customer success?**


**Join our Nordic Sales Team**



The Nordic Sales Team is a dynamic, high-performing group delivering Akamai's industry-leading cloud, security, and content delivery solutions to customers across Denmark, Sweden, Norway, Finland, and Iceland. As a hub for digital transformation, the Nordic region offers exciting opportunities to work with innovative businesses and make a real impact.



At Akamai, 90% of our sales management team has grown their careers with us. If you’re ambitious, customer-focused, and ready to succeed, we’d love to hear from you.


**Grow and strengthen relationships with a portfolio of existing customers**



You will manage and grow relationships with existing customers, identifying opportunities to drive growth while ensuring they get maximum value from Akamai's solutions. Operating in a digitally advanced market, you'll play a key role in driving revenue, customer retention, and satisfaction through proactive outreach and solution alignment.



As a Senior Inside Account Executive, you will be responsible for:


* Managing and developing great relationships with existing customers across the Nordic region
* Identifying growth opportunities by upselling and cross-selling Akamai's solutions
* Owning the full sales cycle, from proactive outreach to pipeline management and account renewals
* Serving as a trusted advisor, aligning customer needs with Akamai's cutting-edge technology
* Collaborating with Solution Engineers and Product Experts to deliver tailored solutions
* Minimizing churn by showcasing Akamai's ongoing value and impact


**Do what you love**



To be successful in this role you will:


* Possess proven consultative sales skills with experience in upselling, cross-selling, and managing existing accounts (B2B, technology, or SaaS)
* Have a track record of meeting or exceeding targets (quota achievement)
* Have exceptional communication skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders via phone, email, and social media
* Possess solid problem-solving abilities, professionalism, and a customer-first mindset.
* Have experience with pipeline management and accurate forecasting


**Work in a way that works for you**



FlexBase, Akamai's Global Flexible Working Program, is based on the principles that are helping us create the best workplace in the world. When our colleagues said that flexible working was important to them, we listened. We also know flexible working is important to many of the incredible people considering joining Akamai. FlexBase, gives 95% of employees the choice to work from their home, their office, or both (in the country advertised). This permanent workplace flexibility program is consistent and fair globally, to help us find incredible talent, virtually anywhere. We are happy to discuss working options for this role and encourage you to speak with your recruiter in more detail when you apply.
  

  

Learn what makes Akamai a great place to work



Connect with us on social and see what life at Akamai is like!

  

**We power and protect life online, by solving the toughest challenges, together.**



At Akamai, we're curious, innovative, collaborative and tenacious. We celebrate diversity of thought and we hold an unwavering belief that we can make a meaningful difference. Our teams use their global perspectives to put customers at the forefront of everything they do, so if you are people-centric, you'll thrive here.


**Working for you**



At Akamai, we will provide you with opportunities to grow, flourish, and achieve great things. Our benefit options are designed to meet your individual needs for today and in the future. We provide benefits surrounding all aspects of your life:


* Your health
* Your finances
* Your family
* Your time at work
* Your time pursuing other endeavors


Our benefit plan options are designed to meet your individual needs and budget, both today and in the future.


**About us**



Akamai powers and protects life online. Leading companies worldwide choose Akamai to build, deliver, and secure their digital experiences helping billions of people live, work, and play every day. With the world's most distributed compute platform from cloud to edge we make it easy for customers to develop and run applications, while we keep experiences closer to users and threats farther away.


**Join us**



Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you!  

  

Akamai Technologies is an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity Employer that values the strength that diversity brings to the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race/ethnicity, protected veteran status, disability, or other protected group status.  

  

#LI-Remote  

  

If no date is displayed, applications are being accepted on an ongoing basis until the job is filled.
company_description: At Akamai, we make life better for billions of people, billions of times a day.

title: Principal Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**Daily Tasks:**

* Design and develop and review advanced machine learning models and architectures, including deep learning, optimization, and generative AI systems
* Lead complex AI/ML project initiatives, providing technical guidance and architectural oversight to cross-functional engineering teams
* Conduct in-depth research and experimentation to evaluate emerging AI technologies, assess their potential applications, and develop proof-of-concept solutions
* Review and optimize existing AI systems for performance, scalability, and efficiency, implementing advanced techniques like model compression and transfer learning
* Collaborate with product managers and stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical AI strategies and implementation roadmaps

**Minimum Technical Skills:**

* Expert-level proficiency in Python, with deep understanding of machine learning libraries
* Advanced knowledge of machine learning algorithms, neural network architectures, and AI model development
* Extensive experience with cloud platforms (must have GCP, nice to have Azure) and AI/ML cloud services
* Strong background in statistical modeling, data preprocessing, and feature engineering
* Proficiency in big data technologies and distributed computing frameworks
* Demonstrated ability to design and implement scalable machine learning infrastructure

**Leadership and Experience Level:**

* Minimum of 8-10 years of professional experience in AI/ML engineering
* Proven track record of leading complex AI initiatives from conception to production
* Senior technical leadership experience, capable of mentoring junior engineers and driving technical strategy
* Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Demonstrated innovation in AI research or practical applications

**Offer due date:** 2025-01-05

**Start date:** 2025-01-07

**End date:** 2025-06-30

title: Tech Management Consultant
description:
Join our expanding company and help great Swedish organizations unlock the value of technology and ensure improved business value. We offer services in tech management & governance, IT and solution architecture, cloud design, core business systems and automation technologies. Our team is composed of innovative and forward-thinking professionals who are dedicated to achieving excellence where we combine technology capabilities with a human centric approach.


We are looking for forward thinking experienced tech management consultants with experience working as a tech or business analyst within IT and Tech implementation projects.

**Your Role:**

* Work as a team lead, project manager, IT implementation projects or IT strategy and assessment assignments
* Take on tech and business analyst roles to understand business requirements and needs for technology system implementation and ensure business alignment
* Take on tech analyst roles where our team is providing strategic technology advice in IT landscape and application simplification, or process automation needs
* Work with and lead teams within, testing, requirement gathering, process modeling or system implantation
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to drive IT projects
* Be actively involved in the expansion and development of our company as a whole by engaging with our practice areas, developing offerings, driving business development, and contributing to sales
* Stay updated with industry trends, the latest developments in IT and emerging technologies to continuously enhance service delivery.

**Your** **p****rofile**:

* 3-8 years’ experience working as a tech management consultant
* Proven track record working as an IT, tech or business analyst, team lead or junior project lead in implementation of IT systems to support enterprises
* Experience with innovative technology areas, cloud and SaaS implementation, automation, core business systems and business platforms
* Knowledge and a solid interest in AI technologies is a plus.
* Strong understanding of business processes and the ability to align technology solutions with business objectives
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with clients and team members.
* University educated – minimum bachelor's degree
* Fluent Swedish and English is essential to be able to work with our customers

 **What we can offer:**

* The opportunity to work on interesting projects, in the areas of IT core system implementation, technology strategy, planning and assessments, automation of business processes, cloud optimization, IT landscape assessments, and IT governance improvements
* You will be able to focus on tech projects at some of the most well recognised brands/companies in Sweden.
* You get to work alongside some of the most well-respected tech management consultants in the sector, and to learn from each other.
* To work in a flat hierarchal company with a focus on other things than administration and internal processes.
* A work culture that promotes a healthy work-life balance.
* The opportunity to learn, understand and utilise Collective Intelligence to affect change, transformation and collaboration in a more effective way.

 **About** **us:**


Influence Tech is an exciting Tech Management Consulting company based in Stockholm. We are expanding further, and we want to meet you who want to be involved in shaping Influence Tech. We want to give our customers maximum value and are not afraid to test new ways of thinking to build a wonderful and warm culture with us. You who apply to us are passionate about creating value for our customers, you are alert and take the initiative to make a difference.


Influence Tech is part of the Newground Alliance, an alliance with twelve niche consulting companies totaling 300+ consultants. Our common motto is "Consulting Done Right", and this means that we want to create valuable and sustainable results for our customers and at the same time care about the well-being of everyone in the team.


We review applications continuously and look forward to your application!


https://influencetech.se/


#InfluenceTech

title: Digital Domain Lead within Digital Workplace
description:
*Research shows that women and other under-represented groups within our industry hesitate to apply unless they tick most boxes of a role description. At Stegra, we are building an impact company with sustainability at its core. We need a diverse, inclusive, and authentic team to rally behind our purpose of de-carbonizing hard-to-abate industries, starting with steel.*  

  

*So, i**f you are equally passionate about our purpose yet concerned that your experience doesn**’**t* *perfectly* *align with the qualifications stated in the job advert, we strongly encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate, either for this role – or for another upcoming role in our* *rapidly* *growing* *business**.*

**About us:**


Stegra, formerly know as H2 Green Steel, is on a mission to disrupt the global steel industry by producing green steel, with the end goal of bringing down CO2 emissions to zero. By using green hydrogen and fossil-free electricity instead of coal; water and heat will be our primary emissions. By 2030, our ambition is to produce 5 million tonnes of green steel annually in our fully integrated, digitalized, and sustainable plant in Boden, located in northern Sweden - currently in construction phase. But this is just the beginning – our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize other industries in addition to steel, and we look forward to what’s next in store for us.


We are looking for talented, innovative, and purpose-driven people to join our rapidly growing and diverse team. Our employees get to learn everyday, implement the latest technology and test and put their ideas into practice. Together, we are building an impact company with sustainability at its core – for our people, customers, investors, society, and planet.

 **So why join us?**

* **Be part of a fresh start:** Play a pivotal role in creating innovative solutions from scratch that will stand the test of time.
* **Make a lasting impact:** Work in a forward-thinking, fast-moving organization aiming to transform the industrial sector for good.
* **Shape the future:** Collaborate with diverse, passionate colleagues to tackle challenges that matter, in a company committed to creating a better tomorrow.

  

We are committed to creating a diverse workforce, valuing different nationalities, genders, and ages. We actively strive to increase gender diversity, with a particular focus on encouraging more women into the industry. We believe diversity is the key to our success, as varied perspectives and experiences help us find the right path forward in solving complex challenges - it’s all about **We, Not Me – Together**.

 **Digital Domain Lead within Digital Workplace**

The Digital Domain Lead is responsible for driving the implementation of innovative digital workplace and internal IT solutions to enhance employee productivity, streamline workflows, and improve collaboration across the organization. This role requires close collaboration with business stakeholders to understand organizational needs, prioritize features, and align IT initiatives with broader business goals. The Digital Domain Lead guides product roadmaps, oversees technology development, and ensures successful adoption of tools that empower employees and support organizational agility.

 **Responsibilities:**

**Understand and Translate Business Needs**

* Collaborate with department heads, IT managers, and employees to gather requirements.
* Align digital workplace initiatives with business strategies and operational goals.

**Prioritize and Manage Backlogs**

* Prioritize and maintain the product backlog, ensuring that critical features are addressed.
* Incorporate feedback from end-users and stakeholders into development plans.

**Collaboration with Development Teams**

* Work closely with IT and development teams to define technical requirements.
* Oversee sprint planning to ensure timely and effective delivery of features.
* Foster open communication between teams to drive alignment and shared success.

**Stakeholder Communication and Training**

* Regularly update stakeholders on project progress, feature performance, and adoption rates.
* Design and deliver training programs that build confidence and enthusiasm for digital workplace tools.

**Focus on Continuous Improvement**

* Drive adoption of modern technologies such as automation, collaboration platforms, and AI-driven tools to optimize internal IT operations.
* Monitor user feedback and engagement metrics to refine and enhance digital workplace solutions.

 **Q****ualifications:**


We are looking for a person that,

* Has extensive experience in digital workplace solutions, internal IT, or related fields, with a proven ability to deliver impactful results and manage cross-functional projects in corporate IT environments.
* Is familiar with modern technologies like cloud computing, AI, automation, and data analytics, and understands how to apply them in workplace contexts.
* Communicates technical solutions clearly to non-technical stakeholders and has expertise in change management to drive digital adoption across diverse teams.
* Is organized and results-oriented, capable of balancing multiple initiatives while fostering alignment and collaboration.
* Brings an understanding of IT service management and workplace tools (e.g., Slack, Miro, Monday.com) and can define roadmaps, prioritize backlogs, and execute agile plans.
* 

 **Location:** Boden or Stockholm, Sweden


The role works from both Stockholm and Boden but candidates who can work from Boden are preferred. If based in Stockholm, there will be regular visits to Boden.


We will review applications after **January 15th** and you can first expect an update on the process after that.

**What we can offer you**

  

If you are passionate about making actual change and having a positive impact on society and our planet, Stegra offers a unique opportunity to be part of a fun and professional team with high ambitions.


You will get the opportunity to shape your future career together with a company focusing on creating a culture where everyone can thrive and feel a sense of belonging. In the end, we know that Stegra's growth and success is dependent on our people and we can’t wait to shape the future of steelmaking and other industries together as a team.

title: Global Retail Coordinator (E-commerce)
description:
**About Fotografiska**  

Fotografiska is the Contemporary Museum of Photography, Art, and Culture, and one of the world’s leading destinations dedicated to photographic art. Established in Stockholm in 2010 with the mission to inspire new perspectives and a more conscious world, Fotografiska has become a home for inspiration, inclusivity, and creativity. Fotografiska is located in Stockholm, Tallinn, Berlin, Shanghai and will open in Oslo in 2027. The museum showcases the world’s foremost photographers and has exhibited leading artists over the years, including Annie Leibovitz, Zanele Muholi, Andy Warhol, Ren Hang, and Robert Mapplethorpe. For more information about our museum, visit: https://www.fotografiska.com/.

**About the role**  

Do you have a passion for e-commerce, digital marketing, and supply chain management? Are you ready to take the lead in driving digital retail excellence within a growing global network of cultural venues? Fotografiska is now seeking a Global Retail Coordinator (E-Commerce) to join our Global Retail team and shape the future of our online shop and the global retail strategy.  

  

As our Global Retail Coordinator (E-commerce), you will play a vital role in driving Fotografiska’s global retail and e-commerce presence across existing and new markets. You will be implementing strategies to grow digital sales, optimize product offerings, and create additional revenue opportunities while supporting the broader Global Retail team with product planning and logistics. In this position, you're located at the Stockholm office and will be reporting to the Global Director of Supply Chain - Retail. You will have an overall responsibility for the following tasks:

  

* Lead and manage Fotografiska’s e-commerce operations across all global markets.
* Collaborate with the Global Supply Chain Director on pricing, promotion, fulfillment, and logistics strategies.
* Own the e-commerce product assortment strategy alongside key stakeholders
* Build and maintain strong supplier relationships, including negotiations and agreements.
* Monitor stock levels at 3PLs and manage replenishment plans.
* Partner with Marketing to devise tailored digital retail campaigns for local markets.
* Ensure product data accuracy, including margins, imagery, and descriptions, across all sales channels.
* Analyze site KPIs with the FP&A team to identify opportunities and improve performance.
* Organize and execute product photo sessions and deliver optimized assets for e-commerce use.
* Support merchandise projects, including design, production, and distribution for exhibitions.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in supply chain, economics, purschasing or logistics.
* 2+ years of experience in e-commerce, digital marketing, or a related field.
* Familiarity with supply chain, procurement, or logistics is highly valued.
* Proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud (Photoshop, InDesign) and knowledge of modern web technologies.
* Experience in the arts and cultural sector is a plus.
* Hands-on experience with Shopify or other web platforms is preferred.

**Who we are looking for**  

We are looking for someone who excels in planning and tracking lead times to ensure seamless operations. As a Global Retail Coordinator, you are driven, sales-oriented, and motivated to achieve ambitious goals. You bring a positive and proactive approach to implementing change and demonstrates excellent problem-solving skills to tackle challenges effectively. The person we are looking for has a keen eye for detail and ensures accuracy in every task as well as possesses exemplary numeric and analytical skills to interpret data and drive performance.
company_description: Fotografiska is redefining the whole art experience and building a leading cultural lifestyle brand.

title: Systemnära ekonom för Cloud-projekt
description:
Nu bubblar det ordentligt och vi behöver fler ekonomer som älskar det här med affärssystem. Du kommer få arbeta med marknadens hetaste affärssystem SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud. Det är snabba implementationer, i tighta team och i nära dialog med kunden.


Vi ser att du har arbetat i och med SAP sedan tidigare och att du kan ekonomiområdet på dina fem fingrar, såsom extern- eller internredovisning, konsolidering eller liknande. Du har varit involverad i flera SAP projekt som superuser eller konsult.  

  

Du brinner för att göra det svåra enkelt och att utgå från de fördelar ett standardsystem har. Vi utgår från best practice som finns i SAP och visar på möjligheterna. Våra kunder står ofta inför en spännande tillväxtresa. Tillsammans skapar vi framtidens vinnare!

**Det här hjälper dig att lyckas i rollen:**

* Vårt starka team inom SAP S/4 HANA och tillgång till vår demomiljö
* Stretch Evolve har redan flertalet fina kundreferenser inom S/4HANA
* Stretch Evolve fick som enda nordiska partner “SAP Excellence Award EMEA"
* I Sverige vann vi 2024 SAPs utmärkelse “Business Partner of the Year”
* Du har tillgång till Sveriges bästa nätverk inom SAP S/4 HANA internt och externt

**Vi tror att:**

* Du har en god systemerfarenhet inom SAP och finans
* Du har erfarenhet av projekt inom SAP S/4 HANA
* Du är nyfiken på att lära nya saker
* Du gillar att kliva fram och ge tydliga rekommendationer


Hoppas du är lika Nyfiken på oss som vi är på vem du är!


Hälsar Teamet på Stretch Evolve


PS. Vi söker också kollegor till vårt starka SAP-team på Västkusten!
company_description: Stretch gör skillnad genom att ha affärsvärde i fokus, leveransförmåga i toppklass och entreprenörskap i vårt DNA. Dessutom har vi riktigt roligt när vi jobbar tillsammans. Följ med oss!

title: Junior Support Engineer
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**


We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.


Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 200 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.

 **THE ROLE**

  

You’ll join a well versed, “jack of all trades” team called the Solutions team, our scope is wide, reaching from e-com integrations, endpoint management, procurements to installing network equipment in our four warehouses. The solution department sorts under the Tech Department and works closely with multiple departments in the company.


As a Junior Support Engineer in the Solutions team, you will be working with a wide range of departments, amazing co-workers, and a high variation of tasks. Your main objective is to give our co-workers within Haypp a helping technical hand, resolving issues high to low. This can vary from replacing a HDMI cable, troubleshoot why outlook is not working as expected, onboard a new co-worker by helping to setup their gear, to remotely restore computers across the Atlantic. You will have the opportunity to be a part of a wide range of IT projects outside of the day-to-day together with our senior engineers.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Respond to IT issues, including hardware maintenance, software, and networking.
* Help set up, install, and configure hardware and software systems according to specifications.
* Provide technical assistance and training to users to improve their computer skills.
* Work on IT projects together with Cloud Workspace Engineers.
* Identify and troubleshoot technical issues on-site or remotely.
* Monitor and maintain computer systems and networks to ensure they run smoothly.
* Document actions taken to resolve IT issues to develop a solutions database and for future reference.
* Escalate complex issues to Cloud Workspace Engineers.
* Perform regular updates and maintenance tasks on company devices and systems.
* Assist in the creation and maintenance of IT documentation, including procedural guides and manuals

 **WHAT WE WANT FROM YOU**

  

* A good understanding of computer systems, mobile devices, and other tech products.
* Knowledge of network management, system maintenance, and user support.
* Experience from support ticket systems like Jira.
* Strong problem-solving and communication skills.
* The ability to explain complex IT concepts in simple terms.
* Knowledge in endpoint management using tools like Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Defender, Microsoft Purview, and SIEM tools such as Microsoft Sentinel are a plus.
* Ability to work 100% on-site or hybrid remote with a minimum of 3 days/week in the Stockholm office


**WHAT WE OFFER**


We are a value driven company with our values *We team up*, *Innovation Drives Us*, *No Douchebags* and *Going the Extra Mile* at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.


Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings

 **SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**


If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!


Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.


If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Viktoria Sobolewski or Philip Anderberg at viktoria.sobolewski@hayppgroup.com, philip.anderberg@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Senior Cloud & FinOps Engineer
description:
- **Är du en duktig molningenjör med passion för både tekniska lösningar och kostnadsoptimering? Vill du arbeta i skärningspunkten mellan molntjänster och ekonomi? Då kan Devoteam M Cloud vara platsen för dig!**  

  

Är du redo att rulla upp skjortärmarna och delta i äventyret?
  

Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
  

  

**Devoteam** är ett ledande internationellt konsultföretag som arbetar med digitala transformationer. Vi har över 10 000 kollegor i 20 länder.
  

  

Vi på **Devoteam M Cloud** är specialiserade på Microsoft Azure och blev bland annat utsedda till Partner of the Year (Norge) av Microsoft 2023. Vi söker nu fler duktiga kollegor som vill vara med och skapa fantastiska molnresor för våra kunder. Hos oss möter du en miljö som inte bara handlar om teknisk innovation, utan också om att ha roligt på jobbet! Våra medarbetare brinner för att leverera de bästa lösningarna inom Azure, optimering och modernisering.

  
**Ansvar**

* Automatisera molntjänster och kostnadsoptimering: Skapa säkra och skalbara lösningar som ger fullständig insyn i kostnaderna med verktyg som PowerBI och Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
* Spela en nyckelroll i kundens FinOps-resa: Du kommer att hjälpa våra kunder att förstå och förbättra sina molnkostnader, vilket säkerställer att deras investeringar ger maximalt värde
* Arbeta nära med tvärfunktionella team: Tillsammans med kunden, våra tekniker och utvecklare kommer du att leverera holistiska, smarta lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad.

  
**Kvalifikationer**

* Praktisk erfarenhet av att jobba med Infrastruktur som kod (IaC)
* Minst 3 års praktisk erfarenhet med molntjänster (Azure, AWS og Google Cloud)
* Du har gedigen erfarenhet av att skapa intuitiva PowerBI-instrumentpaneler som ger kunderna full insikt i deras kostnadslandskap.
Du är en problemlösare som arbetar bra med både tekniska och ekonomiska intressenter.  
* 

  

**Personliga egenskaper**

* Du har ett strukturerat arbetssätt och förmåga att se både helheten och detaljerna
* Du är lösningsorienterad och har en proaktiv inställning till problemlösning
* Stark förmåga att samarbeta, samtidigt som du tycker om att arbeta självständigt
* Du är nyfiken på ny teknik och vill ständigt utveckla din kompetens

  
- **Vi erbjuder:**


	* Möjligheten att arbeta i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö med spännande kunder och projekt
	* Konkurrenskraftiga villkor och utvecklingsmöjligheter inom både teknik och karriär
	* En professionell miljö där kunskapsdelning och kontinuerligt lärande är en del av kulturen
	* Tillgång till de senaste tekniska verktygen och plattformarna för att effektivt lösa komplexa utmaningarHos oss får du möjlighet att använda din expertis för att bygga framtidens
  

dataplattformar, samtidigt som du arbetar nära innovativa projekt som skapar mätbara
  

resultat. Vi söker en person som är redo för nya utmaningar och som vill utvecklas vidare i en spännande och framtidsorienterad miljö.
  

**Är det här du? Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!**
company_description: Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms, cybersecurity and business transformation.

title: Tech Lead Manager
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 You will act as both Tech Lead and Manager, in a perfect mix of leading people (Team of Developers) and developing code. Our aim is to consolidate the team of developers that you will lead in Stockholm. You will collaborate with your Product Partner, regarding planning and building the right products at the right time. You will be responsible for defining clear goals for your team and lead them in delivering on those goals.
   

  

 Apart from this, you are also responsible for setting salaries, helping individuals on your team grow and developing, as well as contributing technically to the team.
   

  

 As Tech Lead Manager you have a holistic perspective and the ability to inspire and lead others. You love working with tech and have experience working as a developer, working with code reviews, testing and quality assurance. You have at least one area where your team can rely on you making strong technical contributions.
   

  

* Communicate and collaborate with stakeholders
* Define quarterly goals and do weekly follow-ups
* Support and make sure the team members are the best they can be
* Develop and coach your team members individually
* Facilitate daily stand-ups and advise on agile WoW
* Contribute technically (wherever your strong area is) to the team


**Requirements**
* MSc/BS in computer science or similar degree
* Experience working as a Manager for a Tech Team
* Working in different contexts and organisations
* Interest in leadership and developing teams
* Proficient in English, both verbal and written
* Business minded and able to see the big picture
* A natural leader who is caring and inspiring
* Able to communicate clearly, both with your team and stakeholders
* Well organized and goal oriented


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Solutions Architect
description:
**Avigna is hiring Solution Architect** 




  





 Our IT Delivery Center aims to build strong and sustainable solutions for customers across Europe. We are looking for Technical Lead to join the team to build, support and drive customer innovations, bringing efficiency to the processes through efficient management of cost and schedule.The role is for a
 **(Solution Architect)** 
 specializing in designing and implementing AI-driven solutions for Predictive and Proactive Operations
 



  





 In alignment with Avigna’s values, we are committed to providing an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.
 



  





 Location : Stockholm
 



 Mode : Onsite
 



 Experience : 7+
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Design AI-driven solutions using platforms like Azure, GCP, and Vertex AI to enhance Predictive and Proactive Operations.
* Translate business requirements into scalable architectures, ensuring alignment with industry standards.
* Collaborate across teams to ensure seamless implementation of solutions while reducing technical debt.
* Oversee data architecture, AI/ML lifecycle management, and end-to-end system design.
* Mentor teams and promote architectural best practices.



**Required Skills:** 



* Expertise in AI/ML tools (TensorFlow, PyTorch), cloud platforms (Azure, GCP), and ITSM tools (ServiceNow, Splunk).
* Proficiency in Python, R, and modern development practices (MLOps, data pipelines).
* Strong knowledge of solution design, data architecture, and SLA compliance.



**Preferred:** 



* Certifications in Azure or GCP, experience with predictive analytics, and integration with third-party tools.



**Qualifications:** 



* 7+ years in software engineering/solution architecture, with 2+ years in a lead role.
* Bachelor’s in Computer Science or related field; advanced certifications preferred.



**Soft Skills:** 



* Strong analytical, leadership, and collaborative skills.



  





 What we offer:
 



  




* Access to a strong developer community within the company to learn and grow.
* Competitive Salary, Good work-life balance along with health and life insurance.

title: Enterprise Account Executive
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
**Company Description**
 Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has nine offices worldwide.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Enterprise Account Manager will be responsible for generating new business sales revenue. This will be achieved through account planning, territory planning, working with Nexthink partners, using business development techniques and field-based sales activities.
   

  

**Your role**
* Achieve sales goals and targets for assigned territory on a quarterly and annual basis by:
* Developing a sales strategy in the territory with a target prospect list and a regional sales plan.
* Develop a regional strategy and plan to leverage Nexthink partners while supporting the closure of deals from Switzerland.
* Developing marketing plans with the marketing team to drive revenue growth and pipeline
* Taking a consultative approach with customers by understanding their existing challenges and future strategies to drive the Nexthink solution within the marketplace.
* Prospect qualification and the development of new sales opportunities and ongoing revenue growth
* Sales process management
* Ongoing account management to ensure customer satisfaction


**Qualifications**
* New business sales focus
* Previous sales experience gained within software or solution sales organizations
* Demonstrable track record of achieving sales goals
* Bachelor's Degree or equivalent
* Fluent in English & Swedish
* Willingness to Travel


**Additional Information**
 We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers’ IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.
   

  

 With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‘Nexthinkers’ and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

title: Project Manager
description:
Job Opening: Project Manager
   

  

**Company:** 
 BluEdge

 Stockholm (SE)

 Openbid
   

  

 BluEdge is seeking a Project Manager to oversee the establishment of a cloud support function for Region Stockholm. The successful candidate will be responsible for leading the governance, cloud architecture technical prerequisites, and migration of customers' capacity services to Microsoft Azure cloud services. This role requires a seasoned professional with extensive experience in technical project management in healthcare and a proven track record of leading complex IT projects in larger organizations.
   

  

 Responsibilities:
   

  

* Lead the establishment of a cloud support function for Region Stockholm
* Oversee governance, cloud architecture technical prerequisites, and migration of customers' capacity services to Microsoft Azure cloud services

title: Technical Product Manager - Shared Components (Real Time Communication)
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**About The Role**
 We're seeking a highly motivated and experienced Technical Product Manager to own and drive the roadmap and requirements for critical shared components within our Real Time Communication product suite. You will be the key link between engineering, product and product operation stakeholders, ensuring alignment and successful delivery of impactful solutions.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Our Real-Time Communication team is building the future of real time communication for enterprises! We're passionate about creating seamless and engaging experiences across a suite of products that connect people worldwide. This includes programmable voice, in-app calling, verification, number lookup and fax solutions. All of these products generate billions of events every year that results in insightful and business critical data both for us at Sinch and for our customers. As we continue to grow and innovate, we need a talented Technical Product Manager to lead the charge of our platform team, Shared Components.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Define and implement a strategy for collecting, analysing, and leveraging AI and usage data across all RTCx products.
* Define roadmap and requirements for our common financial and business intelligence pipelines.
* Define roadmap and requirements for our configuration tool used for operating all RTCx products.
* Work closely with product managers across different RTCx products and Sinch to ensure seamless integration and consistent data model and standard.
* Provide technical guidance and support to the engineering team, contributing to architectural decisions and technology choices.


**Requirements**
* Professional experience as a Technical Product Manager with a focus on backend systems, data platforms or API based products.
* Experience of defining and detailing requirements.
* Strong knowledge of data flows, billing, account management, and configuration tools in large-scale systems.
* Proven track record of managing complex, cross-functional projects with a focus on scaling and reliability.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and various stakeholders.
* Technical background or experience with backend development, data infrastructure and analytics is highly preferred.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to deep dive into the technical details and complexity.
* Familiarity with data privacy regulations (e.g. GDPR) and AI.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: (Associate) IT Monitoring Engineer – based in Luxembourg
description:
This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
   

  

 The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for
 **Group Corporate Services Directorate – Group Digital Office (GCS-GDO), Platforms & Services Department (P&S), Operations & Services Desk Division (OSDK), Monitoring, Automation & Orchestration Unit (MAO)** 
 at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an
 **(Associate) IT Monitoring Engineer\*.**
**This is a full-time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* internal benchmark (Associate) Engineer IT Technology & Infrastructure


 Panel interviews are foreseen as from January 2025.
   

  

 Purpose
   

  

 Would you like to contribute to the Digitalisation strategy with your knowledge of the monitoring domain? In this role you will manage the daily operations (RUN) and delivery of the monitoring of infrastructure and business application technologies.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 You will report to the Head of Monitoring, Automation and Orchestration Unit, which is responsible for providing IT services for monitoring, automation, and orchestration.
   

  

 You will collaborate with colleagues from across the EIB Group, including external consultants and suppliers of software and/or related services.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Contribute to the implementation of the EIB strategy for effective use of IT technology in the domain of monitoring systems
* Ensure that projects are managed and that solutions are designed and implemented in line with internal standards and procedures and that best practice, security recommendations and industry standards are respected
* Manage and coordinate all project phases and project teams (consultants) for the implementation of complex projects
* Develop and maintain dashboards, alerts, and reports to proactively identify and address potential issues.
* Collaborate closely with the IT Security Unit, keeping up-to-date on key vulnerabilities, risks and audit
* Leverage technology to automate manual tasks, and seek efficiency gains
* Drive problems and incidents resolution in coordination with the Incident and Problem Manager
* Maintain hardware and software in the latest levels of patching and supported versions
* Be responsible for framework contract management related to Monitoring scope (including license and subscription usage) in collaboration with the Head of Unit
* Manage the relationship with the managed service provider, ensuring service delivery aligns with agreed-upon SLAs and KPIs.
* Act as the primary point of contact for internal teams regarding monitoring services provided by the managed service provider.


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in computer science or related disciplines
* At least 3 years of relevant professional experience in monitoring IT infrastructure or application, with exposure on application logs and/or application performance monitoring
* Experience in running daily operations as well as IT projects
* Proven experience of monitoring tools deployment, provisioning and configuration (e.g. Splunk, Dynatrace)
* Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash) for automation.
* ITIL knowledge in Change, Release, Incident and Problem Management
* Previous exposure to Artificial Intelligence would be highly advantageous
* Experience in delivering Monitoring solution to cloud and hybrid environments would be an advantage
* Experience managing or working with Managed Service Providers (MSPs) is a significant advantage.
* Understanding of procurement and service contracts, including procuring software and services in a public sector environment would be an advantage
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*), with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

*This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.*

title: Data Scientist/ML Engineer
description:
Insights & data is a global business line within Capgemini, comprising 27,000 experts. Our focus? Creating reliable, scalable data platforms with cutting-edge technology. From GenAI  to business intelligence, we cover it all. Join us in transforming industries through end-to-end Data & AI solutions. We work across industries and have a collaborative environment, where your unique perspective matters.
   

  

 Unlock Exciting Opportunities as a Data Scientist/ML Engineer!
   

  

**YOUR ROLE**
 Are you passionate about shaping the future through data-driven insights? Imagine a role where you collaborate with clients, unravel complex challenges, and drive meaningful impact. As a Data Scientist/ML Engineer, you’ll be at the forefront of innovation, using a modern tech stack to transform businesses.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Data Alchemy: Dive into data wrangling, craft algorithms, and deploy solutions that matter and create insights.
* Wide Horizons: From predicting amusement park visitors to optimizing direct marketing, your canvas is vast.
* Cloud Magic: We’re all about Databricks and cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud).


**YOUR PROFILE**
* Experience: You’ve polished your skills as a Data Scientist/ML Engineer, but still feel eager to continue to grow and take on new challenges.
* Python Wizardry: Pandas, Scikit, PyTorch—these are your allies.
* Version Control: Git is your trusty sidekick.
* SQL Savvy: You speak the language of databases.
* Pedagogical Flair: Explain Data Science like a pro.
* Academic Roots: Math, engineering, IT—your foundation matters.
* Language Mastery: You speak Swedish and English fluently—essential for client interactions.


 Bonus Points for:
   

  

* Generative AI: Unleash creativity.
* Knowledge graphs: Neo4j is our go-to tool.
* Databricks: Our secret sauce.
* MLOps Champion: CI/CD, continuous training—your playground.
* Stable Solutions: Kubernetes and Docker mastery.
* Business Acumen: Beyond code, grasp the bigger picture.
* Data Ecosystem: Know your Data Engineering and Business Intelligence.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
 We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
   

  

 At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
   

  

 Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies such as Generative AI, Databricks and Microsoft Azure.
   

  

**APPLICATION**
 Ready to shape the future? Feel free to ask for more details!
   

  

**About Capgemini**
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world while creating a tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market-leading capabilities in AI, cloud, and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Senior Client Success Manager
description:
Benify is an international HR tech company that provides a market-leading global benefit and total rewards platform. With over 550 Benifyers in 6 countries, we're driving success with over 1500 customers and approximately three million users around the world 🌍. We empower people to be the best they can be while fostering a sustainable and engaging work culture where employees feel engaged and included "Because People Matter" 💙.
 



**About the role** 




 As Senior Client Success Manager, you support multinational global clients in our total reward and benefits platform - Benify. By ensuring high product value and platform usage, you play a vital role in building and maintaining strong client relationships, resulting in client satisfaction with high renewal and low churn.
 



**You will for instance:** 



* Client Success Management - be responsible for existing multinational global clients and local enterprises
* Work closely with Key Account Management to set up ways of working with new global clients and nurturing the long-term client relationships
* Improve processes and ways of working with existing clients
* Educate and ensure active client utilization of the solution, as well as lead client meetings
* Solve incoming client requests as well as coordinating incidents and smaller technical projects
* Support more junior Client Success Managers when needed and distribute work between Client Success Managers having split responsibility for clients



**What we are looking for** 



* Minimum 2 years of experience working as a client success manager
* Professional language skills in English, written and spoken
* Experience managing senior stakeholders
* Experience managing enterprise clients







**It's a big advantage, thus not required if you also have ⭐** 



* Experience working at a SaaS-company and/or within the Benefits industry
* Experience managing global clients



**Who are you?** 




 To succeed in this role, you are a team-player who thrives working in a collaborative environment where you get to interact with internal and external stakeholders daily. Being
 **communicative** 
 is also key to manage our global clients successfully. You have a solution-driven approach and enjoy being
 **analytic** 
 and applying your
 **problem-solving** 
 skills. You are
 **customer oriented** 
 and prestige-less, always striving to find the best solution for us clients when coordinating incidents and solving client requests. Last but not least, it's crucial to be
 **organized** 
 and good at prioritization to handle multiple clients effectively.
 



**Perks of being a Benifyer** 




 Join a dynamic and innovative SaaS company dedicated to helping employers improve their relationships with employees worldwide. As a Benifyer, you'll enjoy a forward-thinking culture that encourages personal and professional growth. We offer an entrepreneurial environment that values creativity and new ideas, with a commitment to diversity and inclusion. With a nearly gender-balanced team, we prioritize creating a supportive workplace where everyone can thrive.
 



**Practical information** 




**Start:** 
 As soon as we find our match
 



**Extent:** 
 Full-time
 



**Location:** 
 Hybrid in any of our offices, London, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, Vilnius, Stockholm, Gothenburg, Malmo or Munich
 



**Work model:** 
 Hybrid (2-3 days in the office)
 



 Apply by submitting your CV and/or your LinkedIn profile in English, using the application form below. We screen applications continuously and may hire someone before the last application date.
 



 Please let us know if you need any reasonable adjustments for interviews by replying to the email you will receive after you apply!
 







***Please note, during the holiday season, our recruitment process may take a little longer than usual due to end-of-year breaks. We kindly ask for your patience, as feedback or updates might be delayed.***

title: Senior Solution Sales Executive - Nordics
description:
**Company Description**
**Devoteam is a leading Google Cloud Partner, empowering businesses to harness the full potential of Google Cloud technologies.**
  

  

  

 With 20+ years ofsuccessful Google Cloud implementations and a team of certified experts, we drive digital transformation across various industries. We foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning, providing you with the tools and support you need to excel in your career.
   

  

 At Devoteam, we champion a revolutionary "New Way of Work" that prioritizes flexibility, personal growth, and joint success.
   

  

  

**Job Description**
**Accelerate Your Career: Senior Solution Sales Executive - Google Cloud**
 Are you a seasoned sales professional with a passion for cloud technology and a proven track record of success in the IT consulting space? Devoteam is seeking a highly motivated Senior Solution Sales Executive to join our expanding Google Cloud practice. In this role, you will drive new business acquisition and revenue growth by selling our comprehensive suite of Google Cloud consulting services and solutions, with a focus on professional services.
   

  

**What You'll Do:**
* **Develop and execute a strategic sales plan:** 
 Target key accounts, identify opportunities, and build a strong pipeline to achieve ambitious quotas and revenue targets.
* **Become a Trusted Advisor:** 
 Conduct in-depth needs assessments, understand client challenges, and position Devoteam as their go-to partner for Google Cloud solutions.
* **Deliver Winning Presentations:** 
 Craft and deliver compelling sales presentations that showcase the value proposition of our Google Cloud offerings, emphasizing our expertise in professional services.
* **Collaborate with Experts:** 
 Work closely with our technical consultants to design and propose tailored solutions that address client requirements, ensuring seamless project delivery.
* **Negotiate and Close Deals:** 
 Secure favorable terms and conditions, maximizing revenue and profitability while building long-term client relationships.
* **Stay Ahead of the Curve:** 
 Maintain a deep understanding of the evolving Google Cloud ecosystem, including new products, services, and market trends, to provide cutting-edge solutions.


  

  

**Qualifications**
* **Proven Success:** 
 A demonstrable track record of exceeding sales targets in the IT consulting services industry, with experience selling technology solutions.
* **Cloud Expertise:** 
 Strong understanding of cloud computing concepts, with specific knowledge of the Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* **Enterprise Focus:** 
 Experience selling to enterprise clients is highly desirable, with a proven ability to navigate complex sales cycles and build relationships with key decision-makers.
* **Communication & Presentation Excellence:** 
 Exceptional communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts clearly and concisely.
* **Negotiation & Closing Prowess:** 
 Strong negotiation and closing skills, with a proven ability to secure favorable deals.
* **Team Player:** 
 Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team in a fast-paced environment.
* **Education:** 
 Bachelor's degree in business, technology, or a related field.


  

  

**Additional Information**
 Devoteam is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected. We encourage applications from individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
   

* **Competitive Compensation:** 
 Enjoy a competitive compensation package with an uncapped commission structure, rewarding your hard work and success.
* **Comprehensive Benefits:** 
 Benefit from comprehensive health insurance, a retirement plan, and generous paid time off.
* **Growth Opportunities:** 
 Take advantage of excellent opportunities for professional development and career advancement within our growing Google Cloud practice.
* **Cutting-Edge Technology:** 
 Work with the latest Google Cloud technologies and contribute to impactful projects that transform businesses.
* **Dynamic Culture:** 
 Be part of a dynamic, supportive, and collaborative team culture that values innovation and personal growth.
* **Flexible Work Arrangements:** 
 Enjoy flexible work arrangements that allow you to balance your professional and personal life.


**To Apply:**
 Please submit your resume and cover letter. We are excited to hear from you!

title: SEB Tech Programme: Cloud Engineer, Google Cloud
description:
**Som Cloud Engineer hos SEB är du en del av vår moderniseringsresa och blir specialist på molnlösningar!**
 Som Cloud Engineer inom Advisory hos SEB i Stockholm arbetar du i ett team som utvecklar moderna Cloud-baserade lösningar i Google Cloud för verksamhetskritisk data. Här hamnar du i händelsernas centrum mot en ännu mer datadriven bank där data och analys är nyckeln till framgång!
   

  

 Parallellt med rollen som Cloud Engineer deltar du även i vårt talangprogram SEB Tech Programme, som ger dig en bred inblick i en stor och komplex, internationell organisation via fördjupat lärande och nätverkande. Med andra ord får du en unik möjlighet att utvecklas inom IT i en modern organisation med hög förändringstakt!
   

  

**Din framtida roll och ditt team**
 Vårt team inom Advisory ansvarar för data för alla SEB:s kundsegment, från privatkunder till företagskunder. Vi tror att med hjälp av moderna molnlösningar kan vi arbeta smartare med data och skapa innovativa lösningar för våra kunder. I dagsläget har vi en hybrid-miljö med applikationer både on-prem och i Google Cloud. Som Cloud Engineer kommer du utveckla lösningar i Google Cloud samt migrera befintliga on-prem applikationer till molnet.
   

  

 Du blir en del av ett teknikintresserat team med högt i tak. Just nu ligger fokus på modernisering och vi vill gärna ha din hjälp! Alla svar finns inte idag, utan en del av vårt dagliga arbete är att tillsammans hitta nya vägar framåt.
   

  

**Din framtida chef, Jamie Walters, beskriver arbetet på Advisory så här:**
*”Du använder ny teknik för att skapa och förbättra tillvägagångssätt för hur vi arbetar med data. Utöver satsningen på Google Cloud, kommer vi även utforska AI och maskininlärning. Möjligheterna är enorma och det är dina drivkrafter och mål som avgör vad du vill utvecklas inom.”*
**Dina kvalifikationer**
 Har du passion för IT och är nyfiken på SEB? SEB Tech Programme ger dig en kickstart i din utveckling och karriär! Som Cloud Engineer hos oss kommer du ha stora möjligheter att påverka och bidra med dina egna idéer. Därför ser vi att du är självgående med en stark vilja att utforska, testa och implementera kreativa lösningar.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som:
   

  

* Har en akademisk examen IT eller teknik alternativt 2-årig YH-examen inom relevant område
* Tar examen innan programmets start eller har tagit examen inom de senaste två åren
* Är flytande i engelska, i tal och skrift
* Det är meriterande med kunskaper inom Python och intresse för maskininlärning. Det är även meriterande med arbetslivserfarenhet inom IT eller teknik alternativt bank eller försäkring


**Vårt erbjudande till dig**
 I över ett decennium har vi genom SEB Tech Programme erbjudit talanger som är i början av sin IT-karriär att utvecklas till vassa IT-specialister. Idag är SEB en av Sveriges största arbetsgivare inom IT, vilket ger dig goda och spännande möjligheter att förverkliga dina ambitioner.
   

  

 SEB erbjuder dig:
   

  

* Ett sex månader långt talangprogram inom IT, anpassat för professionell och personlig utveckling.
* Spännande affärsutmaningar och ett case-projekt där du kan skapa värde och skillnad för SEB:s affär och organisation.
* Möjligheten att skapa relationer och nätverk inom banken.
* Efter programmets slut är målet att erbjuda dig en anställning i den roll du har blivit antagen till.


**Vill du bli en del av SEB?**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar SEB med Ada Digital, som sköter hela rekryteringsprocessen på ett fördomsfritt och kompetensbaserat sätt. Du söker enkelt via ansökningsformuläret
 **här** 
 med ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil, och alltid utan personligt brev. Notera dock att vi inte kan ta emot några ansökningar via email.
   

  

 Sök jobbet snarast om du är intresserad, men allra senast den 5:e januari! Om du har frågor om tjänsten, vänligen kontakta Sofie Nordvall på sofie.nordvall@adadigital.se .
   

  

**Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på SEB här:** 
**www.sebgroup.com/career**
 Vi är övertygade om att inkludering och mångfald är avgörande för vår framtida framgång. Vi strävar efter en inkluderande och värderingsdriven kultur där medarbetare känner sig uppskattade, respekterade och engagerade oavsett vilka de är, vad de tror på eller var de kommer ifrån.
   

  

 Läs också gärna mer om SEB Tech Programmes upplägg och de andra lediga positionerna till starten 2025 här: https://sebgroup.com/sv/karriar/vem-ar-du/nyexaminerade-och-studenter/tech-program

title: Marketing Communication Manager
description:
**Join Our Team as SMC’s new Marketing Communication Manager!** 




 Are you ready to join an innovative and international company? SMC is seeking a Marketing Communication Manager to lead our efforts in the Nordic and Baltic regions (NBC). With long-term goals and a strategy to become market leaders, you will play a key role in our marketing department.
 



  





**About SMC** 




 Founded in Tokyo in 1959, SMC Corporation is a globally recognized brand in industrial pneumatics. With a presence in over 80 countries, SMC generates nearly 5 billion EUR in revenue and employs more than 23,000 people worldwide. We are a world-leading development and manufacturing company in industrial pneumatics and electrically driven linear units.
 



 Our headquarters is in Stockholm for the Nordics and Baltics region. We also have offices and warehouses in Espoo (Finland), Horsens (Denmark), Lysaker (Norway), Riga (Latvia), Tallinn (Estonia), and Vilnius (Lithuania).
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As the Marketing Communication Manager, you will report directly to the Head of Product & Marketing for NBC. You will contribute to the generation of sales leads, enhance the company image, and lead a group of talented market communication professionals.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop and implement marketing communication strategies in the Nordic & Baltic regions.
* Lead, coach, and manage a team of marketing communication professionals, fostering a collaborative and high-performance culture.
* Coordinate and oversee all marketing communication activities, including digital marketing, PR, content creation, event management, and generating sales leads.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment of marketing strategies with business objectives.
* Enhance the Nordic & Baltic consolidation and best practices on all levels.



  





**Requirements:** 



* Understanding of pneumatic, industrial automation, or similar fields.
* Minimum 3 years of experience managing teams.
* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, or business, or a minimum of 10 years of experience in marketing communication.
* Experience in digital marketing as well as traditional marketing channels such as organizing exhibitions.
* Experience of B2B marketing.
* Knowledge of graphical tools like Adobe Creative Cloud (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.) or similar.



  
 



**Relevant Skills** 
 :
 


* Digital marketing proficiency, and expertise in digital channels.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Experienced and passionate leader with proven management skills.
* Ability to inspire and motivate a diverse team.
* Ability to develop and execute successful marketing communication strategies.



  
 



**Meritorious:** 



* Experience in multi-cultural companies.
* English is the corporate language but skills in Finnish, Norwegian, Estonian, or Lithuanian are an advantage but not a must.



  
 



**Why join us?** 



* We offer a fun and varied job with great freedom and personal responsibility.
* Fantastic colleagues with a friendly and open-minded work environment.
* Development opportunities, and international travel in the NBC region.



  





**Other** 
 :
 


* Full-time employment.8
* Location: at HQ, in the southern part of Stockholm (Sweden), in Espoo (Finland) , or Horsens (Denmark).
* Hybrid work opportunities are available, depending on job needs.



  





  





**Application** 
 :
 



 Apply directly here at LinkedIn or send your CV in English to job.nbc@smc.com. Please reach out to Head of HR Helen Alkfors, alkfors.helen@smc.com if you have any questions.
 



 The last date for application is January 31st, please note that we interview candidates continuously and that the position may be filled before this date.
 



  





**Diversity and Equal Opportunities** 




 At SMC, we believe that diversity drives innovation and success. We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone is valued and respected. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and strive to provide equal opportunities for all.

title: Solution Architect Team Lead
description:
*Do you want to shape the future of construction through digital transformation? As a Solution Architect at NCC you'll get the opportunity to work in an environment influenced by sustainability, digitalization, and innovation.*
**We are building for the future – can you help us enhance our business competitiveness?**
**Your Role And Key Responsibilities**
 As Solution Architect your main responsibility is to ensure that solution design meets business requirements, as well as IT operational and non-business requirements. You will work closely with for example NCC business stakeholders, Enterprise Architects and suppliers where you need the ability to both understand and explain what impact a specific solution will have on the business environment.
   

  

 In short, in this role your communication skills are essential, and it is expected that you are used to manage many stakeholders simultaneously to drive the solution design effectively.
   

  

 As a Solution Architect at NCC, you have professional development possibilities within leadership in two different roles, e.g. Team Lead of a Solution Architect-team for a functional area and Release Solution Lead for coordination of the solution for large and complex scopes.
   

  

**As Solution Architect you will**
* Deliver solution architecture – i.e. design documentation covering several viewpoints like process, application, information and infrastructure.
* Act as a key member of project teams and provide leadership in solution design and ensure the expected quality and cross functional alignment.
